newsitem.title: NEW ZEALAND: RUGBY UNION-UMAGA BACK IN TEST LINEUP, STENSNESS OUT OF SQUAD.
newsitem.headline: RUGBY UNION-UMAGA BACK IN TEST LINEUP, STENSNESS OUT OF SQUAD.

text.p: Wellington, July 30 - Tana Umaga regains his wing berth in the only change to the All Black team for Saturday week's return tri-series rugby test against the Springboks at Eden Park.

The Wellington and Hurricanes winger was forced to miss last Saturday's 33-18 win over the Wallabies in Melbourne following a shoulder and sternum injury he sustained the week before against South Africa.
His replacement in Melbourne, Glen Osborne, has been relegated to the eight-strong reserve bench, which now includes Waikato's Scott McLeod in place of Auckland's Lee Stensness.
Stensness has been dropped from the squad but coach John Hart said he remained a contender for the end-of-year tour of Britain.
Stensness played in all the tests at second five-eighth this year except in Melbourne, where he was replaced by Wellington's Alama Ieremia.

All Blacks: Christian Cullen, Jeff Wilson, Frank Bunce, Tana Umaga, Alama Ieremia, Carlos Spencer, Justin Marshall, Zinzan Brooke, Josh Kronfeld, Ian Jones, Robin Brooke, Taine Randell, Olo Brown, Sean Fitzpatrick (captain), Craig Dowd.
Reserves (from): Glen Osborne, Scott McLeod, Andrew Mehrtens, Ofisa Tonu'u, Mark Carter, Charles Riechelmann, Mark Allen, Norm Hewitt.
